result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ruben Juarez

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor
Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
12:04 PM Cases 22CF195, 22TR691 & 692 called together.  Defendant Ruben Juarez in court, in custody.  Attorney Eugene D Harrington in court for Ruben Juarez.  Attorney Kevin T Schmidt in court for State of Wisconsin. Case 22CF195 on for PH but it will be a Waiver.   Waiver of Preliminary Hearing:  Court informs def of rights to PH; waived by def.  Off record momentarily.  Back on the record.  Court continues questioning.  Court finds waiver of right to PH knowingly, freely, voluntarily made.  Court finds factual basis for bind over.  State files information.  Case on for Arraignment.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, def. waives reading.  Court informs def. of charges, possible penalties and rights.  NG plea entered to all counts. Court advises of right to jury trial and speedy trial.  STC set.  Bond continues.  Atty Harrington motions for extension of time to file NGI.  Court grants.
Status conference scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 09:15 am.

12:04 PM Cases 22CF195, 22TR691 & 692 called together.  Defendant Ruben Juarez in court, in custody.  Attorney Eugene D Harrington in court for Ruben Juarez.  Attorney Kevin T Schmidt in court for State of Wisconsin. Case 22CF195 on for PH but it will be a Waiver.   Waiver of Preliminary Hearing:  Court informs def of rights to PH; waived by def.  Off record momentarily.  Back on the record.  Court continues questioning.  Court finds waiver of right to PH knowingly, freely, voluntarily made.  Court finds factual basis for bind over.  State files information.  Case on for Arraignment.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, def. waives reading.  Court informs def. of charges, possible penalties and rights.  NG plea entered to all counts. Court advises of right to jury trial and speedy trial.  STC set.  Bond continues.  Atty Harrington motions for extension of time to file NGI.  Court grants.
Status conference scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Status conference on November 17, 2022 at 09:15 am.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt:
2:13 PM Cases 22CF195, 22TR691, and 22TR692 called together.  Defendant Ruben Juarez in court, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney James Jay Rennicke Esq in court for the State of Wisconsin. Def appears with Atty Pollak specially appearing today.  Def enters NG pleas in the TR matters.  Case on for an Initial Appearance.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading.  Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights.  NG pleas to misdemeanors.  WTLPH.  Bond continues.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on September 28, 2022 at 11:00 am.

The defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety. Subject to random testing of breath, blood or urine by any law enforcement or corrections officer upon arrest or reasonable suspicion. No driving without a valid driver's license. No driving with any juveniles in the vehicle.  No use or possession of any alcohol.  Defendant is restricted from any establishments whose primary purpose is the sale of alcohol- such as bars, taverns, beer tents, and liquor stores.
